.. _`bio/clusterProfiler/barplot`:

BARPLOT
=======

Draw a bar plot from enriched terms


Example
-------

This wrapper can be used in the following way:

.. code-block:: python

    rule test_enrich_barplot:
        input:
            rds = "enriched.RDS"
        output:
            png = "barplot.png"
        wrapper:
            "0.71.1-435-g5ccb306a4/bio/clusterProfiler/barplot"

Note that input, output and log file paths can be chosen freely.
When running with

.. code-block:: bash

    snakemake --use-conda

the software dependencies will be automatically deployed into an isolated environment before execution.

Software dependencies
---------------------

* ``bioconda:bioconductor-enrichplot=1.6.0``
* ``bioconda:bioconductor-clusterprofiler=3.14.0``
* ``conda-forge:r-cairo=1.5_12``

Input/Output
------------
**Input:**

* A RDS-formatted object containing enriched terms

**Output:**

* A barplot of enriched terms as a PNG image



Notes
-----

Use clusterProfiler enrichXXX to get enriched terms. This may also be used
with gseXXX, but you might want to consider GSEA-like plots.

Parameters:
  * barplot_extra: Extra parameters for barplot



Authors
-------

* Thibault Dayris


Code
----

.. code-block:: R

    #!/usr/bin/R

    # This script takes an enriched terms object from clusterProfiler
    # and builds a barplot of most enriched terms or provided list of
    # pathways

    # __author__ = "Thibault Dayris"
    # __copyright__ = "Copyright 2020, Thibault Dayris"
    # __email__ = "thibault.dayris@gustaveroussy.fr"
    # __license__ = "MIT"

    # Handle enrichment
    base::library(package = "clusterProfiler", quietly = TRUE);
    # Handle graphics
    base::library(package = "Cairo", quietly = TRUE);
    base::library(package = "enrichplot", quietly = TRUE);

    enriched <- base::readRDS(
      file = base::as.character(x = snakemake@input[["rds"]])
    );

    barplot_extra <- "enriched";
    if ("barplot_extra" %in% base::names(snakemake@params)) {
      barplot_extra <- base::paste(
        barplot_extra,
        snakemake@params[["barplot_extra"]],
        sep = ", "
      );
    }
    base::message("Libraries and input data loaded");

    # Build command line
    command <- base::paste0(
      "barplot(",
      barplot_extra,
      ")"
    );
    base::message(command);

    # Build plot
    png(
      filename = snakemake@output[["png"]],
      width = 1024,
      height = 768,
      units = "px",
      type = "cairo"
    );


    base::eval(
      base::parse(
        text = command
      )
    );

    dev.off()
